title: Data Encryption Key
extract: A data encryption key (DEK) is a type of key designed to encrypt and decrypt data at least once or possibly multiple times. ... Data is encrypted and decrypted with the help of the same DEK; therefore, a DEK must be stored for at least a specified duration for decrypting the generated cipher text.
extract_html: A data encryption key (DEK) is a type of key designed to encrypt and decrypt data at least once or possibly multiple times. ... Data is encrypted and decrypted with the help of the same DEK; therefore, a DEK must be stored for at least a specified duration for decrypting the generated cipher text.
